document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

Interstage forms:
TURKEY : Urfa and environs, 7.1931, 2 males , 3 females ( Eshref Bey ) ( NHMUK )
;
Urfa , 1931, 1♂ , 2♀ (leg. Sureya ) ( MfN ). These specimens have more blackened basal part of hind wings, and nearer to the nominotypical form (see
E. gibbera lata
below).

Remarks . This species was recorded as
Eremopeza gibbera ( Stål, 1876 )
by
Jabbari et al. (2015)
from Khorasan, E. Iran, which should be confirmed. The distribution of this species does not cover eastern Iran.
